definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: This principle is known as the "butterfly effect".
sentences.chinese: 蝴蝶效應的結果不可預料。

sentences.english: The Butterfly Effect is the reason.
The "butterfly effect" illustrates the impossibility of making predictions for complex systems.
sentences.chinese: “蝴蝶效應”表明，對複雜系統做出預測是不可能的。

sentences.english: They are self-aware and understand the ripple or butterfly effect.
sentences.chinese: 他們擁有一種自我意識，能理解漣漪效應和蝴蝶效應。

sentences.english: The result of the butterfly effect is unpredictability.
sentences.chinese: 蝴蝶效應的結果不可預料。

sentences.english: This phenomenon is often said that the "Butterfly Effect."
sentences.chinese: 這種現象就是人們常說的“蝴蝶效應”。

definition: lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
hard power (i.e. military and economic power)
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
abbr. for 北愛爾蘭|北爱尔兰[Bei3 Ai4 er3 lan2], Northern Ireland
(Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
